meanings.definition: Developing certain abilities or inclinations at an earlier age than usual.
meanings.sent1: The precocious child started reading before kindergarten.
meanings.sent2: The little girl's precocious talent for painting amazed her parents.
meanings.sent3: The precocious puppy learned to fetch the ball in just one day.
meanings.sent4: Her precocious understanding of complex math problems was like a light in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The precocious plant bloomed earlier than all the others in the garden.

meanings.definition: Showing mature qualities or abilities at an early age.
meanings.sent1: The precocious kitten was already hunting mice at a young age.
meanings.sent2: His precocious wisdom in solving problems impressed his classmates.
meanings.sent3: The precocious squirrel saved nuts for winter in a clever way.
meanings.sent4: Her precocious leadership skills shone brightly in the school play.
meanings.sent5: The precocious starling sang a beautiful melody before all the others.
